class.name: SQLite3Database
class.description: This class wraps the sqlite3* database handle and provides methods for opening, closing, executing SQL, and managing database connections. It corresponds to the SQLite3 database API.

method.name: open
method.description: Opens a new database connection. The database is created if it does not already exist. Returns a new SQLite3Database instance on success, or null on failure.

method.name: open_v2
method.description: Opens a new database connection with extended options. The flags parameter can be used to control the type of database access (e.g., read-only, read-write).

method.name: db_handle
method.description: Returns the database handle associated with the given prepared statement.

method.name: close
method.description: Closes the database connection. Returns SQLITE_OK on success, or an error code on failure.

method.name: close_v2
method.description: Closes the database connection, allowing any pending operations to complete. Returns SQLITE_OK on success, or an error code on failure.

method.name: exec
method.description: Executes one or more SQL statements. This is a simplified version without callback support. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success, or an error code on failure.

method.name: errcode
method.description: Returns the numeric result code for the most recent failed API call associated with this database connection.

method.name: extended_errcode
method.description: Returns the extended numeric result code for the most recent failed API call associated with this database connection.

method.name: errmsg
method.description: Returns a string describing the error for the most recent failed API call associated with this database connection.

method.name: errmsg16
method.description: Returns a UTF-16 string describing the error for the most recent failed API call associated with this database connection.

method.name: errstr
method.description: Returns a string describing the given error code.

method.name: error_offset
method.description: Returns the byte offset into the SQL statement text where the error occurred, if applicable.

method.name: last_insert_rowid
method.description: Returns the rowid of the most recent successful INSERT into a rowid table.

method.name: set_last_insert_rowid
method.description: Sets the value returned by [method last_insert_rowid].

method.name: changes
method.description: Returns the number of rows modified, inserted, or deleted by the most recent INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement.

method.name: changes64
method.description: Returns the number of rows modified, inserted, or deleted by the most recent INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement as a 64-bit integer.

method.name: total_changes
method.description: Returns the total number of rows modified, inserted, or deleted since the database connection was opened.

method.name: total_changes64
method.description: Returns the total number of rows modified, inserted, or deleted since the database connection was opened as a 64-bit integer.

method.name: interrupt
method.description: Causes any pending database operation to abort and return at its earliest opportunity.

method.name: busy_timeout
method.description: Sets a busy timeout for the database connection. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: setlk_timeout
method.description: Sets a busy timeout with additional flags. This is a custom extension.

method.name: is_interrupted
method.description: Returns true if the database connection has been interrupted.

method.name: complete
method.description: Returns true if the SQL string appears to be complete (not truncated in the middle of a statement).

method.name: prepare
method.description: Compiles an SQL statement into a prepared statement object. Returns the prepared statement on success.

method.name: prepare_v2
method.description: Compiles an SQL statement into a prepared statement object with improved error reporting. Returns the prepared statement on success.

method.name: prepare_v3
method.description: Compiles an SQL statement into a prepared statement object with additional flags. Returns the prepared statement on success.

method.name: get_table
method.description: Executes an SQL query and returns the result as an array of arrays. Each inner array represents a row.

method.name: query
method.description: Executes an SQL query and returns a result set for iteration.

method.name: backup_init
method.description: Initializes a backup operation from this database to another database. Returns a backup object on success.

method.name: db_config
method.description: Configures various database options. The operation and arguments depend on the specific configuration.

method.name: get_autocommit
method.description: Returns true if the database is in autocommit mode.

method.name: db_name
method.description: Returns the name of the N-th database attached to the connection.

method.name: db_filename
method.description: Returns the filename associated with a database.

method.name: db_readonly
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the database is read-only.

method.name: txn_state
method.description: Returns the current transaction state for the specified schema.

method.name: next_stmt
method.description: Returns the next prepared statement associated with this database connection.

method.name: busy_handler
method.description: Sets a busy handler callback. The callback is called when the database is busy, with the number of times it has been called. Return non-zero to continue waiting, zero to give up.

method.name: commit_hook
method.description: Sets a commit hook callback. The callback is called before a commit. Return non-zero to rollback the transaction.

method.name: rollback_hook
method.description: Sets a rollback hook callback. The callback is called when a transaction is rolled back.

method.name: update_hook
method.description: Sets an update hook callback. The callback is called when a row is updated, inserted, or deleted. Parameters: type (1=delete, 2=insert, 3=update), db name, table name, rowid.

method.name: autovacuum_pages
method.description: Sets a callback for autovacuum page decisions. The callback receives db name, nPage, nFree, rc and returns the number of pages to autovacuum.

method.name: enable_load_extension
method.description: Enables or disables the loading of SQLite extensions. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: load_extension
method.description: Loads an SQLite extension from a shared library. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: declare_vtab
method.description: Declares the schema of a virtual table. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: overload_function
method.description: Overloads a function for use in virtual tables. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: blob_open
method.description: Opens a blob for incremental I/O. Returns a blob handle on success.

method.name: file_control
method.description: Invokes special operations on the database file. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: db_status
method.description: Returns status information about the database. The array contains current and highwater values.

method.name: db_cacheflush
method.description: Flushes the database cache. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: system_errno
method.description: Returns the system errno value for the most recent I/O error.

method.name: serialize
method.description: Serializes the database into a byte array. Returns the serialized data.

method.name: deserialize
method.description: Deserializes a database from a byte array. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: limit
method.description: Sets or queries runtime limits on the database connection. Returns the previous limit value.

method.name: table_column_metadata
method.description: Returns metadata about a column in a table. The dictionary contains information like data type, collation, etc.

method.name: db_release_memory
method.description: Attempts to free as much heap memory as possible from the database connection. Returns the amount of memory freed.

method.name: soft_heap_limit64
method.description: Sets the soft heap limit for the database connection. Returns the previous limit.

method.name: wal_checkpoint
method.description: Runs a checkpoint operation on the WAL file. Returns [code]SQLITE_OK[/code] on success.

method.name: wal_checkpoint_v2
method.description: Runs a checkpoint operation with mode control. Returns an array with checkpoint statistics.

constants.constant: Result code indicating a generic error.
Result code indicating an internal SQLite error.
Result code indicating access permission denied.
Result code indicating database is busy.
Result code indicating database is locked.
Result code indicating out of memory.
Result code indicating attempt to write to a read-only database.
Result code indicating cannot open database.
Result code indicating database is empty.
Result code indicating string or blob too big.
Result code indicating data type mismatch.
Result code indicating library used incorrectly.
Result code indicating no large file support.
Result code indicating auxiliary database format error.
Result code indicating bind parameter out of range.
Result code indicating file is not a database.
Result code indicating a row is ready.
Result code indicating the statement has finished executing.
Open flag to create the database if it does not exist.
Open flag to delete the database when closed.
Open flag to allow URI filenames.
Open flag to not follow symlinks.
Limit on the size of a string or BLOB.
Limit on the size of an SQL statement.
Limit on the number of columns in a table.
Limit on the depth of the parse tree.
Limit on the number of terms in a compound SELECT statement.
Limit on the number of instructions in a virtual machine program.
Limit on the number of arguments to a function.
Limit on the number of attached databases.
Limit on the length of the pattern in a LIKE or GLOB operator.
Limit on the number of parameters in an SQL statement.
Limit on the depth of recursion for triggers.
Limit on the number of auxiliary worker threads.
